page.title: 05A Working Watermill
page.content:
Flitwick Mill - a working watermill
Flitwick Mill is one of the few watermills still at work in the country. It is embanked some 12 ft. above the surrounding meadows. Water supply has often been a problem particularly in the summer at harvest. The Mill-work is important because it is typical of the early 19th century although it has been repaired at various times. The Mill has an iron overshot wheel which is 12' wide and 10' in diam. The main shaft carries an iron pit wheel inside the main wall. This engages with a cast iron wallover on the upright shaft. The great spur wheel drives two pairs of stones. A steam engine used to drive a third pair of stones but is today electic- ally operated. The wooden shaft drives various machines on the first floor.
